title: Trump accused of asking staffer to delete camera footage in Florida classified documents case
description: According to an updated indictment unsealed Thursday, Trump asked an aid to delete camera footage at his Mar-a-Lago estate in an effort to obstruct the federal investigation into his possession of classified documents.

title: Paris 2024: Ukraine takes important step towards Olympic participation
description: Ukrainian athletes are now able to compete with Russians and Belarusians under a neutral banner. This was the case, on Thursday, July 27, for fencer Olha Kharlan, who defeated a Russian rival but was disqualified for failing to shake her hand.

title: Odessa: wheat silos and historic buildings under Russian fire
description: From July 19 to 24, 2023, the major Black Sea port city and surrounding region were subjected to five successive nights of bombardment, the most violent attack since the start of the Russian invasion.

title: Montreal hit hard by destructive fentanyl use
description: Since the Covid-19 pandemic, Montreal has sunk deeper into a public health crisis due to an explosion in the number of fentanyl overdoses.

title: Israelis back on streets to protest judicial overhaul vote
description: Protesters rallied on Thursday evening in Tel Aviv, the epicenter of the demonstrations since the judicial overhaul package was first unveiled in January. On Monday, lawmakers passed a key component of the reform after opposition lawmakers boycotted the vote.

title: Wildfire in Greece triggers explosions at an ammunition depot and the relocation of fighter jets
description: A wildfire whipped on by strong winds triggered a series of massive explosions Thursday at an air force ammunition depot in central Greece, while firefighters worked to tame multiple blazes in the country.

title: July 2023 on track to be world's hottest month ever recorded
description: Exceptional temperatures, mainly caused by greenhouse gas emissions, have led to heat waves and fires in large parts of the northern hemisphere this month.

title: Women's Tour de France: Bauernfeind holds off pack to win stage 5
description: Lotte Kopecky still has the yellow jersey for the overall leader.

title: France's Marchand wins 200m medley gold for third world title
description: Léon Marchand won the 200m individual medley to add to his 400m IM and 200m butterfly titles at the swimming world championships in Fukuoka, Japan.

title: Climate: 'The era of global boiling has arrived', UN warns as July set to be hottest month on record
description: The UN said Thursday that July is 'extremely likely' to be the hottest month in recorded history as blistering heatwaves grip swathes of the planet.

title: Niger military chief backs coup, president stands his ground
description: The military command declared support for the troops who sealed access to President Mohamed Bazoum's residence and said they 'decided 'to put an end to the regime'

title: Prosecutors request dismissal of case over death of Adama Traoré in police custody
description: Seven years after the 24-year-old's death, which has become a symbol of police violence in France, prosecutors concluded that no offense was committed.

title: ECB hikes interest rates for ninth time in hope of fending off inflation
description: The central bank's deposit rate now stands at 3.75%. The move follows a similar decision by the Fed of the United States on Wednesday.

title: Ukraine allows its athletes to compete alongside Russians and Belarusians under neutral banner
description: Ukrainians are still forbidden from taking part in competitions if Russian or Belarusian athletes compete under their national flags, the Ukrainian sports minister announced on Wednesday.

title: Russia calls for 'rapid release' of Niger president
description: Similar demands were issued by the UN and the EU after Mohamed Bazoum was detained by elite troops who claimed to have taken power in the West African nation.

title: Sinead O'Connor, singer of despair and revolt, has died
description: The Irish musician died on Wednesday at age 56. Known for the global hit 'Nothing Compares 2 U,' released in 1990, she caused a scandal by tearing up a photo of Pope John Paul II live on television.

title: Power grab in Niger further destabilizes the Sahel
description: President Mohamed Bazoum was one of France's last allies in the region. On Wednesday night, members of the Presidential Guard announced that he had been deposed.

title: Putin hosts African leaders in St Petersburg in bid to salvage reputation
description: The second Russia-Africa summit, taking place on July 27-28, provides an opportunity for the Russian president to reassure his African counterparts, some of whom are anxious about the consequences of the war in Ukraine.

title: Daigo Matsui's 'Just Remembering' chronicles a couple's story in reverse
description: In a temporal treasure hunt, the director traces the love lives of young Japanese lovers as they go back in time.

title: France seeks greater influence in the Indo-Pacific region
description: President Emmanuel Macron is visiting Vanuatu and Papua New Guinea on July 27 and 28, to give shape to France's strategy for the region, despite limited resources.

title: US Fed announces 11th rate hike since March 2022
description: On Wednesday, the US Federal Reserve raised its main policy rate by a quarter point, to between 5.25% and 5.50%, its highest level since 2001.

title: Russia's limited economic interests in Africa
description: Vladimir Putin is bringing African leaders together for a second Russia-Africa summit in St. Petersburg to be held on Thursday and Friday. With the exception of wheat, oil and arms, Moscow remains a secondary partner for the continent.

title: Macron denounces 'new imperialism' in Pacific
description: While visiting Vanuatu on Thursday, the French President sought to underscore France's importance in a region over which China and the United States are competing for military, economic and diplomatic influence.

title: Hawks regain influence at the European Central Bank
description: Initially modeled on the Bundesbank, the ECB has undergone profound changes under Italy's Mario Draghi, but German influence has gradually taken the upper hand again.

title: Paris 2024: The participation of Russian and Belarusian athletes, a 'poker game'
description: Initially banned from world sport by the International Olympic Committee, the Russians could now return to competitions under a 'neutral' banner. These conditions have been described as 'unacceptable' by Ukraine, which is threatening to boycott the Paris Games.

title: In the Strait of Gibraltar, the revenge of the orca Gladis
description: Killer whale 'attacks' on sailboats in these waters have been multiplying over the past three years. According to scientists, all the cetaceans involved in these incidents belong to the family of a female hit by a boat in 2020.

title: Tiago Rodrigues wraps up his first, outstanding Festival d'Avignon
description: The Portuguese playwright and director’s inaugural festival combined a festive mood with artistic and societal audacity – in short, theater at its most archaic and at its most futuristic.

title: Léon Marchand, world champion in 200m butterfly, the 'new monster' of swimming, captivating Japanese crowds
description: After setting a world record in the 400m individual medley, the French swimmer won gold again on Wednesday in the 200m butterfly in Fukuoka.
